title: Renée Zellweger hints at another Bridget Jones movie

Fans of the Bridget Jones movies will be pleased to hear that Renée Zellweger would be on board for a fourth film.

The 50-year-old actress, who is currently promoting her latest film Judy, where she plays icon the Judy Garland, discussed her openness to continuing the Bridget Jones film franchise - that last saw Bridget become a mother in Bridget Jones's baby.

Sharing her fondness on the idea, when asked if she would consider reprising her role as Bridget and continuing on the story as Bridget tackles parenting, Renée told Australian talk show The Project: "Oh, gosh, yeah, wouldn't that be fun?"

The Texan born star gushed: "It's really the best job, it really is. So much weirder than folks can imagine from the outside."

(Image: Kristina Bumphrey/StarPix/REX)

The Oscar winner's talk show appearance comes after she gushed that she's "thrilled" she "looks different" as her happiness shows.

Rumours were swirling the actress had plastic surgery when she hit the red carpet in 2014.

However, Renée has shrugged off the comments as she defiantly declared she was "glad" people thought she looked different.

(Image: WENN)

(Image: PA /Universal)

She told The Sun : "I'm glad folks think I look different. I'm living a different life, happy, more fulfilling life and I'm thrilled that perhaps it shows.

"People don't know me in my forties. People don't know me as healthy for a while.

"Perhaps I look different. Who doesn't as they get older?"

Previously, she laid bare the "painful" experience and humiliation she felt when she overheard strangers on a train negatively talking about her appearance.

(Image: PA)

Renée recalled how a man and two women she was sitting next to on the "subway" were chatting about celebrities.

She told US radio station SiriusXM's: "They were talking about Hollywood and how Hollywood ladies are so silly, especially that Renée Zellweger.

"How could she do that? Why would she go and have surgery on her face like we wouldn’t know?"
description: The award-winning actress is keen to continue the Bridget Jones film franchise
